gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.po
Class AbstractBasePo<K extends Key>

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.po.AbstractBasePo<K>
Type Parameters:
K - Type of the persistent object key.
All Implemented Interfaces:
PersistentObject<K>, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractModificationRecordPo
public abstract class AbstractBasePo<K extends Key>
extends Object
implements PersistentObject<K>

Abstract base for implementation of PersistentObject. When an attribute of a PersistentObject is annotated as child PersistentObject then its setKey(key) method will be called by the setKey method of its parent.
This class offers functionalities necessary mainly in cases where the key of the persistent object is composite and consists of more than one elements. In this case, the children of the persistent object usually have keys consisting by the properties of the key of the father plus some additional properties. In this case it is difficult to ensure that always the keys of the children remain children of the father's key. This class offers this functionality. Implementations of PersistentObject can be abstract classes with some fields annotated with the appropriate annotations. The Factory will create the appropriate concrete class.
The following limitations apply:

  • Child collections can only be of type Set. All these collections can be declared as sets. These sets are created by the constructor.
  • Child element must always be PersistentObjects. Defining a child element that is not instance of PersistentObject makes no sense. The reason to mark an element as child is to have its key modified by the father's key. If the child can't be modified by the father's key it is useless to mark it as child.
  • Child elements are owned by this instance. Their existence either in the java heap or in the persistence layer makes no sense without this object

    • See Also:
